description: Borrowed from Italian niello, from Latin nigellus (“blackish”).

nouns.description: niello (countable and uncountable, plural niellos or nielli)

entries.meaning: (metallurgy) Any of various black metal alloys, made of sulphur with copper, silver or lead, used to create decorative designs on other metals.
examples: a young woman named Renata, with a gesturing of her dark curls, beckoned him in with a cigarette-case of Russian silver and niello, which sprang open to reveal a collection of “smokes”  […]

entries.meaning: An impression on paper taken from the engraved or incised surface before the niello alloy has been inlaid.

verbs.description: niello (third-person singular simple present niellos, present participle nielloing, simple past and past participle nielloed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To decorate (a surface) using this technique.
